consumerEServiceCatalog.title: E-service catalog
consumerEServiceCatalog.description: In this section you can explore all the e-services in the catalog and subscribe to the ones you are interested into

consumerAgreementsList.title: Your requests
consumerAgreementsList.description: In this section, you can manage all the fruition requests you have sent to e-service Providers

providerEServiceList.title: Your e-services
providerEServiceList.description: In this section you can manage all the e-services you are providing

providerAgreementsList.title: Fruition requests
providerAgreementsList.description: In this section, you can manage all the fruition requests you have received from parties that want to subscribe to your e-services

consumerPurposesList.title: Your purposes
consumerPurposesList.description: In this section you can manage all the purposes you have created

consumerClientList.title: Your e-service clients
consumerClientList.description: Here you can manage the clients that allow you to obtain a voucher that can be spent at the providers' e-service APIs

consumerClientM2MList.title: Your Interop API clients
consumerClientM2MList.description: Here you can manage the clients that allow you to obtain a voucher that can be spent at the PDND Interoperabilit√† API

providerPurposesList.title: Purposes
providerPurposesList.description: Here you can manage the purposed created by you's e-service's subscribers

tenantCertifier.title: Tenant certifier
tenantCertifier.description: In this view you can manage the certified attributes you have created and their assignment

providerKeychainsList.title: Your keychains
providerKeychainsList.description: Here you can manage you keychains

delegations.title: Delegations
delegations.description: Here you can manage all the delegations you have given or received from other entities

providerEServiceTemplatesCatalog.title: E-service templates catalog
providerEServiceTemplatesCatalog.description: Templates allow you to create e-service instances from pre-existing template.
